title: Compiler bug in macos (apple-darwin), compiles and gives error message in playground

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use std::collections::HashMap; use std::fs; fn main() { // if env::args().len() < 1 { // println!("Program requires as least 1 arguments."); // return; // } // let filename = env::args().nth(1).unwrap(); let filename = "earth_to_the_moon.txt"; let text = fs::read_to_string(filename).unwrap(); let contents = text.split_whitespace().map(|x| x.to_lowercase()); let mut hash_map = HashMap::new(); for word in contents { let count = hash_map.entry(word).or_insert(0); *count += 1; } fn compare(a: &(&str, &i32), b: &(&str, &i32)) -> std::cmp::Ordering { let (_, a_count) = a; let (_, b_count) = b; b_count.cmp(a_count) } let mut sorted = hash_map .iter() .collect::>() .sort_by(compare) .take(10); // println!("The top 10 most flown missions are: {}", sorted); } ``` ### Meta https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021 gives a proper error message `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.2 (9eb3afe9e 2023-03-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9eb3afe9ebe9c7d2b84b71002d44f4a0edac95e0 commit-date: 2023-03-27 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.68.2 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling count_words v0.1.0 (/Users/harrylaou/myworkspace/rust/linkedin-rust-essential-training/count_words) error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/region_constraints/mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 1, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:9 ~ count_words[0ce7]::main::compare::'_#1), '_) }) <= '_#20r thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/9eb3afe9ebe9c7d2b84b71002d44f4a0edac95e0/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:987:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x10cf816e6 - ::fmt::h47bed05ceb7970ee 1: 0x10cfdefca - core::fmt::write::hefd823d99333384a 2: 0x10cf73eac - std::io::Write::write_fmt::hb978956bb1b85e2b 3: 0x10cf814ca - std::sys_common::backtrace::print::hc9e298c4664da113 4: 0x10cf848c3 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::had0599fead9033cd 71: 0x7ff80954b1d3 - __pthread_start note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.68.2 (9eb3afe9e 2023-03-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental=[REDACTED] note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `main` #1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `count_words` ```
